intro: Veronica officinalis var. major, commonly known as greater veronica, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, often arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks.
